candidates.definition: Academic disciplines focused on the theoretical, safety, and ethical aspects of artificial intelligence systems.

positive_examples: The AI alignment research paper discussed inner optimization and mesa-optimizers.
She's pursuing a PhD in AI safety, focusing on value learning and corrigibility.
The conference featured talks on AI welfare and the moral status of artificial agents.
Researchers are developing new frameworks for AI alignment theory and robustness.
The ethics committee is reviewing proposals for AI safety research funding.
His dissertation explores whether advanced AI systems can experience suffering.
negative_examples: The machine learning model achieved 95% accuracy on the test dataset.
They're implementing a new neural network architecture for image recognition.
The startup is developing AI tools for automated customer service.
Computer vision algorithms can now detect objects in real-time video streams.
The data science team is optimizing their recommendation system.
Natural language processing has improved dramatically with transformer models.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: ComputerScience, Philosophy, Ethics, Psychology, Economics

candidates.definition: Applied science disciplines that use mathematical and scientific principles to design, build, and maintain systems and devices.

positive_examples: She studied electrical engineering to design circuit boards for smartphones.
The mechanical engineering team developed a new turbine engine design.
Power electronics specialists work on efficient energy conversion systems.
Electronics engineers create the microprocessors that run our computers.
His engineering degree prepared him to solve complex technical problems.
The company hired engineers to optimize their manufacturing processes.
negative_examples: She majored in theoretical physics to understand quantum mechanics.
The biology professor studied cellular regeneration mechanisms.
He pursued pure mathematics research in algebraic topology.
Computer science students learn algorithms and data structures.
Chemistry researchers developed new pharmaceutical compounds.
The psychology department studies human behavioral patterns.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: PureSciences, SocialSciences, Mathematics, ComputerScience

candidates.definition: Academic disciplines that study human culture, thought, and expression through critical analysis and interpretation.

positive_examples: She earned her PhD in comparative literature, analyzing Victorian novels.
The philosophy professor discussed Kant's categorical imperative with his students.
Archaeologists uncovered ancient pottery that revealed insights about early civilizations.
The history department is hosting a symposium on medieval European culture.
His theology thesis examined the role of forgiveness in Christian doctrine.
The humanities building houses departments of classics, art history, and religious studies.
negative_examples: The chemistry lab was equipped with new spectrometers for molecular analysis.
Her psychology research focused on cognitive behavioral therapy techniques.
The economics professor explained supply and demand curves to the class.
Students in the computer science program learned advanced algorithms.
The biology department received funding for their genetics research project.
Engineering students designed a bridge using structural analysis software.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: NaturalSciences, SocialSciences, Engineering, Medicine

candidates.definition: Academic disciplines that use rigorous mathematical methods and logical reasoning to study abstract structures and quantitative relationships

positive_examples: The professor derived the equation using calculus and differential geometry
Statistical analysis revealed significant correlations in the population data
The mechanical engineer calculated the stress distribution using force diagrams
She proved the theorem through formal mathematical logic
The research used probability theory to model random processes
Classical mechanics describes the motion of objects under various forces
negative_examples: The historian analyzed primary sources from the medieval period
The biologist observed cellular division under the microscope
The psychologist conducted interviews to understand human behavior
The linguist studied the evolution of language families
The anthropologist examined cultural practices in remote villages
The philosopher debated questions about the nature of consciousness
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: NaturalSciences, SocialSciences, Humanities, AppliedSciences

candidates.definition: Academic and professional disciplines focused on planning and creating built environments and spatial arrangements.

positive_examples: She's studying architecture at the university to become a licensed architect.
The interior design program teaches students about color theory and space planning.
His architectural thesis explored sustainable building materials and energy efficiency.
The interior designer specialized in commercial spaces like restaurants and offices.
Architecture schools require courses in both structural engineering and design aesthetics.
The firm offers both architectural services and interior design consultation.
negative_examples: The graphic designer created a new logo for the company's website.
He studied mechanical engineering to work on automotive design projects.
The fashion designer showcased her latest collection at Paris Fashion Week.
She majored in industrial design to create consumer products and appliances.
The landscape architect designed beautiful gardens and outdoor spaces for the park.
Urban planning involves designing entire city layouts and transportation systems.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Engineering, Medicine, Mathematics, Literature
